snakeai.game.constants module¶

Coords¶

class snakeai.game.constants.Coords(x: int, y: int)¶

Bases: object

A class for representing coordinates

Casting to string a Coords object will return the string (x, y) Summing two coordinates together will do the element-wise sum. Two Coords objects can also be compared for equality.

Parameters

  • x (int)

  • y (int)

Variables

  • x (int) – The x coordinate

  • y (int) – The y coordinate

distance(other: snakeai.game.constants.Coords) → float¶

Calculate distance between two coordinates

Parameters

other (Coords) – the other coordinates

Returns

the distance

Return type

float

Raises

TypeError – if other is not of type Coords

manhattan_distance(other: snakeai.game.constants.Coords) → int¶

Calculate manhattan distance between this position and the other

Parameters

other (Coords) – the other coordinates

Returns

the distance

Return type

int

Raises

TypeError – if other is not of type Coords

x: int¶

Actions¶

class snakeai.game.constants.Actions(value)¶

Bases: enum.Enum

The actions that can be chosen to move the snake

DOWN = Coords(x=0, y=1)¶
LEFT = Coords(x=-1, y=0)¶
RIGHT = Coords(x=1, y=0)¶
UP = Coords(x=0, y=-1)¶

Rewards¶

class snakeai.game.constants.Rewards(value)¶

Bases: enum.Enum

The possible rewards values

The isGameOver method can be used to check if a reward is a game over value

AWAY = -1¶
CLOSER = 1¶
ENDED = 100¶
FAILED = -100¶
GOT_APPLE = 100¶
classmethod isGameOver(rew: snakeai.game.constants.Rewards) → bool¶

Check if a reward is considered game over

Parameters

rew (Rewards) – The reward to check

Returns

Whether is game over or not

Return type

Bool
